page.title: 08LAPLEY CHURCH
page.content: Lapley church is nearly 900 years old. The church began when French Monks came to England and made a monastry on a hill in Lapley.On the right of the church was a Manor.Part of the manor was a store house.The church has a large tower and there are two bells,one of them is a big one and the other is not so big.At the top of the tower there is a pattern of crosses carved into the stone.When the raiders were about the monks and the villagers climbed the tower for safety.The French monks were thrown out when the English were at war with the French.The East window is six metres high and is made of plain glass with green tints.The font in the church is made of stone and an eight year old could get in it.The pulpit was made of oak.,There are many patterns carved in stone.Nowadays there is a service
